body_html:
Yes, I believe.
…
On Thu, May 11, 2017 at 11:07 AM, Anthony Platanios < ***@***.***> wrote: I see. Does -march=native automatically use all the instruction sets available in the architecture of the current machine? For example, if the CPU supports the AVX instruction set, will -march=native make the compiler use that? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body:
Yes, I believe.

On Thu, May 11, 2017 at 11:07 AM, Anthony Platanios <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I see. Does -march=native automatically use all the instruction sets
> available in the architecture of the current machine? For example, if the
> CPU supports the AVX instruction set, will -march=native make the
> compiler use that?
